item.text: After qualifying in medicine I started the Multimedia Authoring Centre at Charing Cross Hospital, with funding from Philips and Apple Computer. As Senior Developmental Editor for Times Mirror, I produced over 15 cross platform CDROMs including the award winning "Interactive Skeleton". I formed the Virtual Theatre Company in 1992, working in club environments and receiving recognition from the Arts Council who funded collaborations with Union Dance Company, Laser Creations and real time virtual reality systems. I worked for a number of years for New Media Agencies CHBi, and Lowe Howard Spink. Since 2000 I have worked as a programmer, on commercial and arts based projects in this country and abroad. In Vienna and Berlin I worked on open source / Creative Commons projects, first as an artist and then for 18 months as a project manager for the Community TV Station OKTO. I am currently working on a game/documentary crossover.
